page.title: 19SUPERNATURAL
page.content: A LOCAL GHOST STORY TELLS OF A WHITE LADY WHO WALKS BRAVENER BANK ON THE OUSE IN BENINGBROUGH PARK. ONE VERSION IS TOLD BY BARING-GOULD IN 'YORKSHIRE ODDITIES' BUT HIS DATES DO NOT COINCIDE WITH THE KNOWN HISTORY. IT TELLS OF A BENINGBROUGH MAID WHO WAS EITHER PUSHED INTO THE RIVER OR JUMPED IN TO ESCAPE THE UNWELCOME ADVANCES OF A GAME-KEEPER. ACCOUNTS OF LEGAL PROCEEDINGS CONFIRM THERE WAS SUCH A MURDER TRIAL. BUT WAS THE STORY OF THE GHOST PERPETRATED TO WARN WOULD-BE POACHERS AND TRESPASSERS OFF? ANOTHER LOCAL SAYING WARNED 'BEWARE THE IRON- LADY (MAN-TRAP) AND THE DOGS'.ANOTHER VERSION OF THE INCIDENT IN A BOOK, "BENINGBROUGH HALL" BY J.L.ARMSTRONG OF WORTLEY, TELLS OF THE DASTARDLY MURDER OF A VIRTUOUS HOUSE-KEEPER BY A WICKED STEWARD IN ABOUT 1776.
